knimeNode.name: Interval Loop Start
knimeNode.shortDescription: Node at the start of a loop

fullDescription.intro: The LoopStart is the node that starts a loop that increases a variable within a user-defined interval by a certain amount. This is very handy for nodes inside a loop that take a continuous parameter. The current value is accessible via the scope variable loop_value . At the end of the loop you need LoopEnd, which collects the results from all loop iterations. All nodes in between are executed as many times as you specify in the dialog of LoopStart.
fullDescription.option: The step size by which the value is increased after each iteration. Negative step sizes are possible, if from is greater than to

ports.inPort: The input data, which can be a data table or any other arbitrary port object.
